content.description: Sit start left of the overhang. Move up through a crimp, pinch to juggy holds above the overhang, mantle into the slab, and stand up to reach some nice crimps at the lip.

Sit start on the obvious sidepull rail (pulling to the right), and move upward utilizing sidepulls, bumps, and positive ledges. Once you are standing with your hands on the positive ledges 6 feet up, move upward using the ledges and the obvious huecos the face provides. Top out dead center.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter, but the landing is great.
content.location: This is located on the west face (facing the highway). There is a downclimb on the east side once you top out.

content.description:
Cicatrix climbs very good rock via some fun movement. The first move is one my favorites from the canyon and the finish is engaging.

Sit start with a right incut and a left heel and hand matched on the shelf. From there, crank up with the heel to a left hand undercling-sidepull, walk the feet, reach a right hand edge on the face, match, then traverse left the arete, commit to the slab, mantle atop the boulder.
content.protection: Pair a pads and a spot preferably. The landing starts out with a rock and tree behind it, and the finish climbs over a fairly benign landing, but it sure is nice having pads below.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Glitterati.
